document.docAuthor: Sun, Xin, Yan, Haijuan & Chen, Jian-Xiu
document.docTitle: Allonychiurus megasomus Sun, Yan & Chen, 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the genus Allonychiurus from China (Collembola: Onychiuridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of the genus Allonychiurus from China (Collembola: Onychiuridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : female, China : Jiangsu Province: Nanjing: Qingliangshan Park,
11 .iv. 2006
, collection number C 9459 , collected by XIE Guilin and JIANG Jigang. Paratypes :
9 females
and
1 juvenile
male, same data as holotype . Deposited in School of Life Science, Nanjing University, China ; 2 Paratypes in the Museum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris, France .
Abd. V present absent present present present present seta m0 (after fig. 62 ,

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Allonychiurus megasomus
sp. nov. 1, Dorsal cephalic and thoracic chaetotaxy. 2, Dorsal abdominal chaetotaxy. 3, Right antenna. 4, Ant III sensory organ and ms, dorsal view. 5, Club of Ant III sensory organ. 6, Ant. IV subapical organite.

FIGURES 7–13. 7, PAO and anterior cephalic pso. 8, Labrum. 9, Labial palp. 10, Labium. 11, Ventral side of head, showing chaetotaxy, sensilla, and pseudocelli. 12, Hind tibiotarsus, lateral view. 13, Ventral tube, lateral view.
FIGURES 14–18. 14, Remnant of furca. 15, Male (preadult) genital plate. 16, Female genital plate. 17, Anal spine. 18, Anal valves.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body length: Up to 2.1 mm, holotype 1.46 mm.
Body colour: Milky white in alcohol.
Ecology. Found under moist leaf and grass litter, stones and bricks in woods of deciduous trees and bamboo.
Etymology. The name of the new species is derived from Greek megas and soma . It refers to the large size of the species.

Remarks. The new species is diagnosed by the arrangement and number of pseudocelli, ventral parapseudocelli, dorsal sensilla, the form of the PAO, the chaetotaxy of Abd. IV and V, the number of setae on the tibiotarsus, the unguiculus without basal lamella and the number of setae on the ventral tube.
